messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest
messages.msgSnippet: Oh Michele -- I got chills reading this. For some reason I am REALLY touched by the stories of teenagers who are so unhappy and miserable and troubled in
messages.messageBody:
Oh Michele -- I got chills reading this. For some reason I am REALLY
touched by the stories of teenagers who are so unhappy and miserable
and troubled in school and I'm just so thrilled when I hear of parents
getting their kids OUT and things getting better!!!!

Congratulations and kudos to you for being brave and taking charge!!!

-pam


On Monday, May 19, 2003, at 05:07 PM, michele-nappi@... wrote:

> Yipppeee! This has been our first year at unschooling. We went for our
> first homeschool assessment and everything went very well! The woman
> actually said I had too much information and kept very good records of
> what my two boys and I had done for unschooling. I am SO relieved that
> the process went so well.
> When I first wrote in to this group it was with a sad heart. My 15 year
> old has dyslexia and being at public school had caused a mood disorder.
> He has learned more in the passed few months than he did the last 4
> years at public school. I am so happy. We are all so happy. He is calm
> 95% of the time. He is able to learn and enjoy it at the same time. I
> am
> so grateful for this site. It was what I had prayed for and was guided
> to, I believe. Thank you. Michele
>
>
>

messages.subject: Re: Digest
messages.msgSnippet: ... The woman ... of ... I got that my first couple of years of hsing (I ve slipped through the cracks and haven t been visited in 4 years). I had so much to
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com, michele-nappi@w... wrote:
The woman
> actually said I had too much information and kept very good records
of
> what my two boys and I had done for unschooling. >>


I got that my first couple of years of hsing (I've slipped through
the cracks and haven't been visited in 4 years).
I had so much to show the HS evaluator. He told me I was doing more
than needed. Hah! We were just living.
I thought about it. A regular school teacher would only have to show
maybe 5 or 6 references in different subjects to seem sufficient.
I had atleast 25 different things to show this guy.
Joanna

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest
messages.msgSnippet: Yipppeee! This has been our first year at unschooling. We went for our first homeschool assessment and everything went very well! The woman actually said I had
messages.messageBody:
Yipppeee! This has been our first year at unschooling. We went for our
first homeschool assessment and everything went very well! The woman
actually said I had too much information and kept very good records of
what my two boys and I had done for unschooling. I am SO relieved that
the process went so well.
When I first wrote in to this group it was with a sad heart. My 15 year
old has dyslexia and being at public school had caused a mood disorder.
He has learned more in the passed few months than he did the last 4
years at public school. I am so happy. We are all so happy. He is calm
95% of the time. He is able to learn and enjoy it at the same time. I am
so grateful for this site. It was what I had prayed for and was guided
to, I believe. Thank you. Michele



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
